member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Grids.SpreadsheetCommandType.ToggleSplitPanes
member.summary: Changes the DisplayOptions of the active worksheet to add or remove resizable split areas that are separately scrollable. If the worksheet currently has split areas then the splits will be removed. If the worksheet has frozen areas they will be converted to splits. Otherwise it will create split areas based on the current active cell.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Grids.SpreadsheetCommandType.ToggleFreezePanes
member.summary: Changes the DisplayOptions of the active worksheet to add or remove frozen areas. If the worksheet currently has frozen areas then they will be removed. If the worksheet currently has unfrozen splits then they will be converted to frozen splits. Otherwise it will create frozen areas based on the current active cell.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Grids.SpreadsheetCommandType.FreezeFirstRow
member.summary: Changes the DisplayOptions of the active worksheet so that the first currently visible row will be frozen at the top and the bottom area can scroll from the next row until the last row.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Grids.SpreadsheetCommandType.FreezeFirstColumn
member.summary: Changes the DisplayOptions of the active worksheet so that the first currently visible column will be frozen at the left and the right area can scroll from the next column until the last column.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Grids.SpreadsheetCellRangeFormat.Style
member.summary: Gets or sets the parent of the format.

remarks.p: The parent style of a cell or differential format provides default format values. Depending on which FormatOptions flags are present, only certain groups of format properties will be resolved from parent style. When any of the properties in a group is set to a non-default value, the FormatOptions will automatically have that flag included so the format provides values in that group rather than the style providing values in that group.

By default, all cell and differential formats will have a parent style of the normal style, which is exposed by the property. If a value of null is assigned as the Style for a cell or differential format, then NormalStyle will actually be set.

member.exception: The value assigned is non-null and the format is a style format.
The value assigned is from a different .
member.value: A instance if this is a cell or differential format, or null if this is a style format.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Grids.Primitives.RangeWorksheetCellFormatBase.Style
member.summary: Gets or sets the parent of the format.

remarks.p: The parent style of a cell or differential format provides default format values. Depending on which FormatOptions flags are present, only certain groups of format properties will be resolved from parent style. When any of the properties in a group is set to a non-default value, the FormatOptions will automatically have that flag included so the format provides values in that group rather than the style providing values in that group.

By default, all cell and differential formats will have a parent style of the normal style, which is exposed by the property. If a value of null is assigned as the Style for a cell or differential format, then NormalStyle will actually be set.

member.exception: The value assigned is non-null and the format is a style format.
The value assigned is from a different .

member.name: M:Infragistics.Controls.Grids.ExcelSheetPaneManager.BringIntoView(Infragistics.Controls.Grids.SpreadsheetPane,Infragistics.Controls.Grids.SpreadsheetCell,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Brings the specified portion of the row and/or column into view at the specified offset within the viewable area.
member.param: The pane in which to perform the scroll operation or null to use the ActivePane
The row/column that are to be brought into view.

A float value between 0.0 and 1.0 that represents the relative offset within the viewable that the column should be positioned. 0 represents the left most edge of the viewable area and 1.0 represents the right most edge of the viewable area.
A float value between 0.0 and 1.0 that indicates the relative position of the cell at the specified . 0 represents the left edge of the cell and 1 represents the right edge.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Controls.Grids.SpreadsheetCellEditMode
member.summary: Enumeration used to identify the current edit mode state.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Grids.SpreadsheetCellEditMode.NotInEditMode
member.summary: The spreadsheet is not in edit mode similar to the "Ready" cell mode in Microsoft Excel.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Grids.SpreadsheetCellEditMode.ArrowKeysNavigateBetweenCells
member.summary: The control is in edit mode. Arrow keys will navigate between the cells instead of within the text editor used for editing the active cell's value. This is analogous to the "Enter" cell mode in Microsoft Excel.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Grids.SpreadsheetCellEditMode.ArrowKeysNavigateInCell
member.summary: The control is in edit mode. Arrow keys will navigate within the characters of the text editor used for editing the active cell's value. This is analogous to the "Edit" cell mode in Microsoft Excel.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Controls.Grids.SpreadsheetCellRangeBorders
member.summary: Enumeration used to identify the borders of a cell range.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Grids.SpreadsheetCellRangeBorders.LeftBorder
member.summary: Border at the left edge of the range

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Grids.SpreadsheetCellRangeBorders.TopBorder
member.summary: Border at the top edge of the range.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Grids.SpreadsheetCellRangeBorders.RightBorder
member.summary: Border at the right edge of the range.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Grids.SpreadsheetCellRangeBorders.BottomBorder
member.summary: Border at the bottom edge of the range.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Grids.SpreadsheetCellRangeBorders.InsideHorizontal
member.summary: Horizontal border for all cells within the center excluding the outside edge of the range.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Grids.SpreadsheetCellRangeBorders.InsideVertical
member.summary: Vertical border for all cells within the center excluding the outside edge of the range.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Grids.SpreadsheetCellRangeBorders.DiagonalDown
member.summary: Border running from the upper left corner to the lower right of each cell in the range.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Grids.SpreadsheetCellRangeBorders.DiagonalUp
member.summary: Border running from the lower left corner to the upper right corner of each cell in the range.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Grids.SpreadsheetCellRangeBorders.OutsideBorder
member.summary: Border along the outside of the range. This is equivalent to choosing LeftBorder, RightBorder, TopBorder and BottomBorder.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Grids.SpreadsheetCellRangeBorders.InsideBorder
member.summary: Border along the inside of the range. This is equivalent to choosing InsideVertical and InsideHorizontal

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Grids.SpreadsheetCellRangeBorders.AllBorder
member.summary: Border along the outside and inside of the range. This is equivalent to choosing OutsideBorder and InsideBorder.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Controls.Grids.SpreadsheetCellSelectionMode
member.summary: Enumeration used to indicate the selection is updated when one interacts with the control via the mouse or keyboard.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Grids.SpreadsheetCellSelectionMode.Normal
member.summary: The selection is replaced when dragging the mouse to select a cell or range of cells. Similarly when navigating via the keyboard a new selection is created. One may add a new range by holding the Ctrl key and using the mouse and one may alter the selection range containing the active cell by holding the Shift key down while clicking with the mouse or navigating with the keyboard such as with the arrow keys.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Grids.SpreadsheetCellSelectionMode.ExtendSelection
member.summary: The selection range in the representing the active cell is updated as one uses the mouse to select a cell or navigating via the keyboard.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Grids.SpreadsheetCellSelectionMode.AddToSelection
member.summary: New cell ranges are added to the without needing to hold down the ctrl key when dragging via the mouse and a range is added with the first arrow key navigation after entering the mode. One can enter the mode by pressing Shift+F8.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Controls.Grids.SpreadsheetEnterKeyNavigationDirection
member.summary: Enumeration used to identify the cell to which the should navigate when the enter key (or shift + enter) are pressed.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Grids.SpreadsheetEnterKeyNavigationDirection.Down
member.summary: The cell below should be activated.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Grids.SpreadsheetEnterKeyNavigationDirection.Right
member.summary: The cell to the right should be activated

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Grids.SpreadsheetEnterKeyNavigationDirection.Up
member.summary: The cell above should be activated.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Grids.SpreadsheetEnterKeyNavigationDirection.Left
member.summary: The cell to the left should be activated

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Grids.SpreadsheetOperationResult.Error
member.summary: An error occurred but was not cancelled and so the operation can be skipped.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Grids.SpreadsheetOperationResult.Cancelled
member.summary: An error occurred or the user requested to cancel the operation and retain the current state.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Grids.SpreadsheetOperationResult.Success
member.summary: The operation completed successfully.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Grids.SpreadsheetPaneRowColumnSizingMode.Fill
member.summary: The row or column size is based on the remaining size after those sized based on the extent or contained items

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Grids.SpreadsheetPaneRowColumnSizingMode.SizeToItems
member.summary: The number of items determines the extent of the row or column

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Grids.SpreadsheetPaneRowColumnSizingMode.SizeToExtent
member.summary: The preferred extent determines the extent of the row or column

member.name: T:Infragistics.Controls.Grids.SpreadsheetUserPromptTrigger
member.summary: Identifies the action that led to the prompt being displayed.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Grids.SpreadsheetUserPromptTrigger.ClearCellContentError
member.summary: An error occurred while clearing the contents of the selected cells.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Grids.SpreadsheetUserPromptTrigger.FormulaParseError
member.summary: An error occurred while parsing the formula entered while in edit mode.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Grids.SpreadsheetUserPromptTrigger.EditError
member.summary: An error occurred while attempting to update the active cell or selected cells while exiting edit mode.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Grids.SpreadsheetUserPromptTrigger.InvalidWorksheetName
member.summary: The name entered during an in-place edit/rename of a Worksheet Name violates the constraints.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Grids.SpreadsheetUserPromptTrigger.ConflictingWorksheetName
member.summary: The name entered during an in-place edit/rename of a Worksheet Name conflicts with the name of an existing Worksheet.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Grids.SpreadsheetUserPromptTrigger.DeletingWorksheets
member.summary: One or more worksheets are being deleted which may result in loss of data.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Grids.SpreadsheetUserPromptTrigger.InvalidCommandForOverlappingSelections
member.summary: A command was being invoked that isn't valid when there are selected cell ranges that overlap.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Grids.SpreadsheetUserPromptTrigger.InvalidCommandForMultipleSelections
member.summary: A command was being invoked that isn't valid when there is more than one selected cell ranges.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Grids.SpreadsheetUserPromptTrigger.InvalidCommandForMixedCellSelections
member.summary: A command was being invoked that isn't valid when there are a combination of rows or columns and cells selected.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Grids.SpreadsheetUserPromptTrigger.InvalidNameBoxValue
member.summary: A value was entered into the name box of the formula bar that did not represent the address to navigate to nor a valid name to use for the selection.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Grids.SpreadsheetUserPromptTrigger.PasteCellRangeSize
member.summary: The source area and target areas of the paste operation do have have the same size.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Grids.SpreadsheetUserPromptTrigger.PasteMultipleSourceAndTargetRanges
member.summary: There are multiple cell ranges in the source and target sheets.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Grids.SpreadsheetUserPromptTrigger.PasteInvalidSourceRanges
member.summary: The selection in the source is invalid. Either it is empty/unset or there are multiple cell ranges in the source that do not form a valid copy selection. There must be at least 1 cell range selected and all items must have the same start and end row or start and end column without overlapping and without leaving any gaps.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Grids.SpreadsheetUserPromptTrigger.PasteInvalidSheetCount
member.summary: The number of selected sheets in the target workbook is not an integral multiple of the number of selected sheets in the source workbook.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Grids.SpreadsheetUserPromptTrigger.PasteError
member.summary: An unspecified error occurred during a paste operation.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Grids.SpreadsheetUserPromptTrigger.PasteIntersectsMergedCells
member.summary: The target range(s) intersect with but does not contain one or more merged cells.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Grids.SpreadsheetUserPromptTrigger.IntersectsMergedCells
member.summary: The target range(s) intersect with but does not contain one or more merged cells.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Grids.SpreadsheetUserPromptTrigger.CopyInvalidRanges
member.summary: The selection is invalid for a copy operation. If there are multiple ranges then the items must have the same start and end row or start and end column without overlapping and without leaving any gaps.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Grids.SpreadsheetUserPromptTrigger.General
member.summary: An error occurred during some operation other than the ones relating to the other members of this enum.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Grids.SpreadsheetUserPromptTrigger.TableChangeWithMultipleSelectedSheets
member.summary: The operation cannot be performed when there are multiple sheets selected and the change would affect a table in one of the worksheets.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Controls.Grids.XamSpreadsheet.BringIntoView(Infragistics.Controls.Grids.SpreadsheetPane,Infragistics.Controls.Grids.SpreadsheetCell,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Brings the specified cell into view at the specified location in view.
member.param: The pane in which to bring the cell into view or null to use the active pane
The cell to be positioned within the viewable area
A percent between 0 and 1 that indicate which edge of the cell column to be positioned. 0 is the left edge of the cell and 1 is the right edge of the cell.
A percent between 0 and 1 indicating where that horizontal offset should be within the view. 0 is the left edge of the in view area and 1 is the right edge of the in view area.
A percent between 0 and 1 that indicate which edge of the cell row to be positioned. 0 is the top edge of the cell and 1 is the bottom edge of the cell.
A percent between 0 and 1 indicating where that vertical offset should be within the view. 0 is the top edge of the in view area and 1 is the bottom edge of the in view area.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Grids.XamSpreadsheet.ActiveSelectionCellRangeFormat
member.summary: Returns an object used to get the formatting of the and where modifications are applied to the entire .

remarks.p: Any changes made to this object will affect all the objects in the selection. So for example, the Font.Name may return "Arial" because the active cell has that as its resolved font name even though the other cells are using a different font but if you set the Font.Name of this object to "Arial" then all the objects affected by the selection will have their Font.Name updated to that value.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Grids.XamSpreadsheet.IsInEndMode
member.summary: Returns or sets a boolean indicating whether the control is in "End mode".

remarks.p: End mode is a mode that affects certain keyboard navigation such as navigating with the arrow keys. For example when in end mode and one presses the right arrow, the will be changed to be the first cell to the right of the current ActiveCell that has a value (even if the value is ""). If there were no cells to the right with a value then it would activate the right most cell in that row. End mode will end automatically such as when one presses an arrow key.

member.name: E:Infragistics.Controls.Grids.XamSpreadsheet.WorkbookDirtied
member.summary: Invoked when a change has been made to the that might require a save.

remarks.p: Note: This event is invoked asynchronously with regards to the change(s) that have occurred. Also some changes alone are not considered to dirty the Workbook even though it does change state on the Workbook or one of its subobjects. An example of that would be a zoom type operation (e.g. changing the ).
